message: Fix schema errors
description: The XML files within a wsp solution should not contain schema errors.

message: Declare required attribute 'SolutionId' in Solution
description: Required attribute 'SolutionId' must be declared in Solution.

message: Define a valid GUID for attribute 'SolutionId' in Solution
description: The attribute 'SolutionId' in Solution must be a valid GUID. Otherwise the deployment or retraction of the solution may not work properly.

message: Remove unused files from Solution package
description: Files in the solution package which are not listed in manifest.xml or in a feature.xml should be removed from the package.

message: Declare element 'SafeControl' for each implemented WebControl
description: For each non-abstract class which is derived from 'System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl' a SafeControl entry must be placed inside the manifest.xml.

message: Deploy referenced Assembly with correct version, culture and public key token
description: If an assembly references a different assembly then version, culture and public key token of the referenced assembly must be the same or use BindingRedirects.

message: Do not set SPSite.CatchAccessDeniedException property
description: Property SPSite.CatchAccessDeniedException is reserved for internal use. Use the SPSecurity.CatchAccessDeniedException property instead to specify whether SharePoint Foundation traps and handles "Access Denied" exceptions.

message: Do not set SPSite.ReadLocked property
description: Property SPSite.ReadLocked is reserved for internal and is not intended to be used directly from your code. Use the IsReadLocked property instead.

message: Do not call deprecated members
description: Depending on the target SharePoint version of the solution an assembly in this solution should not call deprecated methods or properties.

message: Do not implement deprecated interfaces
description: Depending on the target SharePoint version of the solution an assembly in this solution should not implement deprecated interfaces.

message: Do not inherit from deprecated type
description: Depending on the target SharePoint version of the solution an assembly in this solution should not inherit from deprecated type.

message: Do not reference deprecated types
description: Depending on the target SharePoint version of the solution an assembly in this solution should not reference deprecated types.

message: Declare required attributes in SiteDefinition
description: Required attributes Title and ListDir must be declared in SiteDefinition.

message: Declare element 'SiteDefinition' in Solution
description: A deployed SiteDefinition should be included correctly in manifest.xml of the Solution.

message: Do not reference WebApplication Feature in attribute 'VisibilityFeatureDependency'
description: The attribute 'VisibilityFeatureDependency' is not supported for Features with Web application scope.

message: Declare required attributes in Feature
description: Required attributes Id and Scope must be declared in Feature.

message: Define a valid GUID for attribute 'Id' in Feature
description: The attribute 'Id' in Feature must be a valid GUID.

message: Remove spaces from Feature folder
description: SharePoint Foundation supports no spaces for Feature folder and file names.

message: Define attribute 'Title' in Feature with max. 255 characters
description: The attribute 'Title' of a Feature is limited to 255 characters.

message: Do not define attribute 'ActiveOnDefault' in Feature with Scope 'Web' or 'Site'
description: Attribute 'ActivateOnDefault' cannot be 'TRUE' for Feature with Scope 'Web' or 'Site', except in Sandboxed solutions. In Sandboxed solutions the attribute is used during activation of the solution to activate Feature with scope 'Site'. This behaviour is not documented in MSDN and may be unexpected und unintended.

message: Do not define attribute 'AutoActivateInCentralAdmin' in Feature with Scope 'Farm'
description: AutoActivateInCentralAdmin cannot be TRUE for Feature with Scope 'Farm'.

message: Define required attributes for Feature receiver
description: Attributes 'ReceiverAssembly' and 'ReceiverClass' must be defined in conjunction.

message: Define correct SolutionId in Feature
description: All features in a solution must correctly reference their parent solution via the SolutionId property.

message: Define ReceiverAssembly in Feature correctly
description: ReceiverAssembly in Feature should contain the full qualified name of the referenced assembly.

message: Define Version in Feature correctly
description: Version in Feature should contain a correct version number.

message: Add missing assembly for 'ReceiverAssembly' in Feature
description: If a Feature references an assembly in attribute 'ReceiverAssembly' the assembly should be available.

message: Deploy the 'ReceiverAssembly' of a Feature to GAC
description: If a Feature references an assembly in attribute 'ReceiverAssembly' the assembly must be deployed to GAC. Otherwise the assembly could not be loaded during feature activation.

message: Declare attribute 'Title' in Feature
description: A Feature should have a Title.

message: Do not define Feature Id with curly brackets
description: A Feature Id should not contain curly brackets at the beginning and end.

message: Add Resources when DefaultResourceFile is declared
description: If attribute 'DefaultResourceFile' is declared the necessary Resource files must be available.

message: Declare required fields in FieldType
description: Required fields Filterable, ParentType, Sortable, TypeDisplayName and TypeName must be declared in FieldType

message: Do not declare field 'InternalType' in FieldTypes
description: Do not use a <Field Name="InternalType"> element in a custom field type definition.

message: Do not declare field 'SQLType' in FieldTypes
description: Do not use a <Field Name="SQLType"> element in a custom field type definition. The field represents the SQL data type that will be used to store the data in the content database, but cannot be used in custom field types.

message: Declare field 'FieldTypeClass' in FieldType
description: Field <Field Name="FieldTypeClass" /> is an optional element, but required for all custom field types. Represents the strong name of the field type class library.

message: Do not use obsolete RenderPattern in FieldTypes
description: RenderPattern in FieldTypes is obsolete.

message: Do not use PropertySchema in FieldTypes
description: PropertySchema in FieldTypes is obsolete.

message: Do not define Field in Feature with scope 'WebApplication' or 'Farm'
description: Field can only be deployed with Features of scope 'Web' or 'Site'.

message: Add curly brackets to Field ID
description: Field ID must contain curly brackets.

message: Define a uniqe Field ID
description: The ID of a Field must be unique in the farm.

message: Define Field ID as valid GUID
description: Field ID must be a valid GUID.

message: Declare required attributes in Field
description: Required attributes ID, Name and Type must be declared in Field.

message: Define Field DisplayName with max. 255 characters
description: The DisplayName of a Field is limited to 255 characters.

message: Do not use deprecated attribute 'FromBaseType'
description: Attribute 'FromBaseType' is deprecated in favor of the Sealed attribute.

message: Declare all recommended attributes in Field
description: All recommended attributes ID, Type, Name, DisplayName, and Group should be declared in Field.

message: Do not define ContentType ID longer than 1024 characters
description: Content type IDs have a maximum length of 512 bytes. Because two hexadecimal characters can fit in each byte, each content type ID has an effective maximum length of 1024 characters.

message: Do not define ContentType in Feature with scope 'WebApplication' or 'Farm'
description: ContentType can only be deployed with Features of scope 'Web' or 'Site'.

message: Declare required attributes in ContentType
description: Required attributes ID and Name must be declared in ContentType.

message: Do not define duplicate ContentType ID
description: ContentType ID must be unique.

message: Do not define ContentType Name longer than 124 characters
description: Length of attribute 'Name' in content types is limited to 124 characters. The name itself cannot be longer than 128 characters and cannot contain the characters \ / : * ? " # % < > { } | ~ &, two consecutive periods (..), or special characters such as a tab.

message: Define ContentTypes ID as hexadecimal GUID
description: It is recommended to use the GUID approach to identify any content types that are direct children of content types you did not create. Use the GUID approach if the parent content type is one of the following. That way, you are assured that the content type ID is unique and will not be duplicated later by the developer of the parent content type.

message: Do not declare attributes in ContentType which are reserved for internal use
description: The attribute 'BaseType' is reserved for internal use and should not be declared in ContentType.

message: Do not declare obsolete attributes in ContentType
description: The attributes 'ResourceFolder' and 'DocumentTemplate' are obsolete and should not be declared in ContentType.

message: Inherit ContentType from existing parent ContentType
description: The parent ContentType of a ContentType must be either a SharePoint ContentType or a ContentType within the WSP solutions.

message: Define correct parent FeatureId in ContentType
description: If ContentType defines attribute 'FeatureId' the value must be correct and include braces.

message: Define attribute 'Inherits' to FALSE in ContentType if RemoveFieldRef are used
description: A content type should not have attribute 'Inherits' set to 'TRUE' if elements of type 'RemoveFieldRef' are used. Set Inherits to 'FALSE' or hide the not used columns with Hidden=TRUE to remove fields from a content type.

message: Define attribute 'Inherits' to FALSE in ContentType if Custom Forms are used
description: A content type should not have attribute 'Inherits' set to 'TRUE' if custom forms are used. Set Inherits to 'FALSE' or remove the custom form from a content type.

message: Do not define Module in Feature with scope 'WebApplication' or 'Farm'
description: Module can only be deployed with Features of scope 'Web' or 'Site'.

message: Add missing referenced File for Module
description: A Module in a Feature deploys files which are included in the feature as ElementFile. The rule checks if this referenced file is available or not.

message: Declare File element in Module
description: A Module should contain at least one File element as child. Otherwise the Module has no need and should be removed.

message: Do not define ListInstance in Feature with scope 'WebApplication' or 'Farm'
description: ListInstance can only be deployed with Features of scope 'Web' or 'Site'.

message: Declare required attributes in ListInstance
description: Required attributes TemplateType, Title and Url be declared in ListInstance.

message: Define unique value for attribute 'Id' in ListInstance
description: If a value is defined for attribute 'Id' is defined in a ListInstance the value must be unique within the same Feature.

message: Deploy missing ListTemplate for ListInstance
description: A ListInstance instantiates lists based on a ListTemplate. This ListTemplate must be either a SharePoint default ListTemplate or a custom ListTemplate which must be deployed.

message: Remove curly brackets from attribut FeatureId in ListInstance
description: Curly brackets should be removed from attribute 'FeatureId' in ListInstance.

message: Deploy missing ListDefinition in CustomSchema of ListInstance
description: A ListInstance can directly reference a ListDefinition in attribute 'CustomSchema'. This ListDefinition must be depoyed in the same Feature as ElementFile.

message: Do not define ListTemplate in Feature with scope 'WebApplication' or 'Farm'
description: ListTemplate can only be deployed with Features of scope 'Web' or 'Site'.

message: Declare required attributes in ListTemplate
description: Required attributes BaseType, DisplayName and Name must be declared in ListTemplate.

message: Do not define ListTemplate Name with spaces
description: Name of ListTemplate cannot contain spaces or special characters.

message: Define unique attribute 'Type' for ListTemplate
description: The attribute 'Type' must be unique within the Feature.

message: Deploy missing Image in ListTemplate
description: If a ListTemplate references a file in attribute 'Image' (e.g. an icon) the file must be deployed.

message: Do not define ContentTypeBinding in Feature with scope 'WebApplication' or 'Farm'
description: ContentTypeBinding can only be deployed with Features of scope 'Web' or 'Site'.

message: Declare required attribute in CustomAction
description: Required attribute 'Title' must be declared in CustomAction.

message: Define unique value for 'Id' in CustomAction
description: Define a unique value for attribute 'Id' in CustomAction. The ID may be a GUID, or it may be a unique term.

message: Deploy missing file in UrlAction for CustomAction
description: If a CustomAction references a file in attribute 'UrlAction' (e.g. ASPX page) the file must be deployed. Otherwise a click on this CustomAction will lead to 404 error.

message: Deploy missing file in ImageUrl for CustomAction
description: If a CustomAction references a file in attribute 'ImageUrl' (e.g. an icon) the file must be deployed.

message: Deploy missing file in Ribbon for CustomAction
description: If a CustomAction references a file in ribbon (e.g. an icon) the file must be deployed.

message: Deploy missing file in CommandUIHandler for CustomAction
description: If a CustomAction references a file in ribbon CommandUIHandler (e.g. a page) the file must be deployed.

message: Declare required attributes in CustomActionGroup
description: Required attributes 'Location' and 'Title' must be declared in CustomActionGroup.

message: Do not define Receiver in Feature with scope 'WebApplication' or 'Farm'
description: Receiver can only be deployed with Features of scope 'Web' or 'Site'.

message: Declare Scope for Receivers in Site Features
description: If event receivers are used within a feature with scope 'Site' the attribute 'Scope' should be specified.

message: Do not define Receiver 'EmailReceived' on SiteCollection level.
description: If email event receivers are used within a feature with scope 'Site' the attribute 'Scope' must be set to 'Web' or the event receiver must be deployed via a web scopes feature.

message: Define ControlAssembly and ControlClass in DelegateControl
description: When implementing a server control (DelegateControl), use both the ControlAssembly and ControlClass attributes.

message: Deploy missing assembly from attribute ControlAssembly
description: When using attribute ControlAssembly the referenced assembly must be deployed to SharePoint or must be a SharePoint assembly.

message: Deploy missing control from attribute ControlSrc
description: When using attribute ControlSrc the referenced ascx control must be deployed to SharePoint or must be a SharePoint control.

message: Do not define Worfklow in Feature with scope 'Web', 'WebApplication' or 'Farm'
description: Worfklow can only be deployed with Features of scope 'Site'.

message: Declare required attributes in Workflow
description: Required attributes Name, CodeBesideAssembly, CodeBesideClass and Id must be declared in Workflow.

message: Define a valid GUID for attribute 'Id' in Workflow
description: The attribute 'Id' in Workflow must be a valid GUID.

message: Do not define DocumentConveter in Feature with scope 'Web', 'Site' or 'Farm'
description: DocumentConveter can only be deployed with Features of scope 'WebApplication'.

message: Declare property 'Title' in WebParts
description: WebPart should contain a title which is visible to the user in SharePoint.

message: Declare required attributes in FieldRef
description: Required attributes ID, Name must be declared in FieldRef.

message: Define attribute 'ID' with curly brackets in FieldRef
description: The attribute 'ID' in elements of type 'FieldRef' should start and end with '}'. Otherwise they may not work correctly.

message: Define attribute 'ID' in FieldRef in correct casing
description: The attribute 'ID' in elements of type 'FieldRef' is case sensitive. It must use the same casing as the ID of the referenced field.

message: Declare required attributes in RemoveFieldRef
description: Required attributes ID must be declared in RemoveFieldRef.

message: Do not declare ignored attributes in RemoveFieldRef
description: Do not declare attributes except ID in RemoveFieldRef. All other attributes are ignored by SharePoint.

message: Define attribute 'ID' with curly brackets in RemoveFieldRef
description: The attribute 'ID' in elements of type 'RemoveFieldRef' should start and end with '}'. Otherwise they may not work correctly.

message: Do not define TemplateAssociation in Feature with scope 'Web'
description: TemplateAssociation (FeatureSiteTemplateAssociationDefinition) can only be deployed with Features of scope 'Site', 'WebApplication' or 'Farm'.

message: Declare required attributes in TemplateAssocation
description: Required attributes Id and TemplateName must be declared in TemplateAssocation.

message: Do not define PropertyBag in Feature with scope 'WebApplication' or 'Farm'
description: PropertyBag can only be deployed with Features of scope 'Web' or 'Site'.

message: Declare required attributes in FeatureActivationDependency
description: Required attribute FeatureId must be declared in FeatureActivationDependency.

message: Define optional attributes in FeatureActivationDependency correctly
description: If optional attributes in FeatureActivationDependency are defined (like the target 'FeatureTitle') the values must be the same.

message: Do not add ActivationDependency to hidden Feature
description: Features with ActivationDependency cannot be hidden.

message: Do not add ActivationDependency to a Feature with a more restrictive scope
description: A Feature cannot have an ActivationDependency to a more restrictive scope. For example, a site collection-scoped Feature cannot have an ActivationDependency on a Web site-scoped Feature.

message: Do not add cross-scope ActivationDependency to a hidden Feature
description: A Feature cannot have an cross-scope ActivationDependency to a hidden Feature. For example, a Web site-scoped feature cannot be dependent on a site collectionâ€“scoped Feature that is not visible in the user interface.

message: Do not chain ActivationDependencies of Features when last Feature is visible
description: ActivationDependencies can work only one level deep. SharePoint Foundation does not support more than one level in activation dependencies if the last Feature is visible.

message: Do not create circular chain of FeatureActivationDependencies
description: ActivationDependencies between Features can result in a circular dependency which is not allowed.

message: Declare element 'DefaultDescription' in schema of ListTemplate
description: The element 'DefaultDescription' must be declared in the schema.xml of a ListTemplate.

message: Declare required attributes in schema of ListTemplate
description: The attribte 'Title', 'Name' and 'Direction' must be declared in the schema.xml of a ListTemplate.

message: Deploy missing assembly for WebService (.svc)
description: A WCF Webservice (.svc) file references an assembly which handles the requests for the WebService. This assembly should be present in the solution.

message: Declare required attributes in WebTemplate
description: Required attributes BaseTemplateID, BaseTemplateName, BaseConfigurationID and Name must be declared in WebTemplate.

message: Derive WebTemplate from an existing Template
description: A WebTemplate must derive from an existing Template, e.g from a template in TEMPLATE\1033\XML\WEBTEMP.xml.

message: Declare recommended attributes in WebTemplate
description: Attributes Title and Description should be declared in WebTemplate.

message: Do not declare obsolete attributes
description: Obsolete attributes should not be declared and should be removed from the code.

message: Define Boolean attributes in upper case
description: Boolean attributes should be define in upper case letters (TRUE or FALSE).

message: Remove spaces from resource keys
description: If attributes in SharePoint elements are localized with resources the resource key cannot contains spaces.

message: Add translation for a resource key
description: If attributes in SharePoint elements are localized with resources the resource key must be available in a resx file.

message: Do not update list of blocked extensions
description: The assembly should not access property Microsoft.SharePoint.Administration.SPWebApplication.BlockedFileExtensions and also update the web application. The rule assumes that the list of blocked file extensions has been changed by the code.

message: Avoid setting 'AllowUnsafeUpdates' on SPWeb
description: The assembly should not call Microsoft.SharePoint.SPWeb.AllowUnsafeUpdates to run make changes to SPWeb with a lower security context. Setting this property to true opens security risks, potentially introducing cross-site scripting vulnerabilities.

message: Avoid setting 'AllowUnsafeUpdates' on SPSite
description: The assembly should not call Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSite.AllowUnsafeUpdates to run make changes to SPSite with a lower security context. Setting this property to true opens security risks, potentially introducing cross-site scripting vulnerabilities.

message: Do not call 'WindowsIdentity.Impersonate'
description: The assembly should not call WindowsIdentity.Impersonate() to run code with higher permissions.

message: Do not set 'AllowEveryoneViewItems' for SPList to TRUE
description: The property ListAllowEveryoneViewItems of the SPList object should not be set to true, as it allows every authenticated user of the web application to access the list items when the URL is known.

message: Avoid usage of 'RunWithElevatedPrivileges'
description: The assembly should not call Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSecurity.RunWithElevatedPrivileges to run code with higher permissions.

message: Do not add PageParserPaths to web.config
description: PageParserPaths can be used to enable inline code in ASPX pages which is not allowed.

message: Do not call 'HttpUtility.HtmlEncode'.
description: The assembly should not call HttpUtility.HtmlEncode(string) to encode strings. Use 'SPHttpUtility.HtmlEncode' instead.

message: Do not nest calls to RunWithElevatedPrivileges
description: Do not call RunWithElevatedPrivileges inside a existing RunWithElevatedPrivileges.

message: CAS Policy 'Maschine' with access='Administer' is not allowed
description: The CAS Policy 'Maschine' with access='Administer' is not allowed.

message: Policy Permission Impersonate not allowed
description: The CAS Policy for Microsoft.SharePoint.Security.SharePointPermission with settings Impersonate=true is not allowed.

message: Do not define 'FileIOPermission' with 'Unrestricted=true'
description: The CAS Policy for System.Security.Permissions.FileIOPermission with setting 'Unrestricted=true' is not allowed. This means read and write permission to all locations on the SharePoint system. Limit the permission to certain folders, e.g. TEMP.

message: Do not define 'RegistryPermission' with 'Unrestricted=true'
description: The CAS Policy for System.Security.Permissions.RegistryPermission with setting 'Unrestricted=true' is not allowed.

message: Do not define 'SecurityPermission' with 'Unrestricted=true'
description: The CAS Policy for System.Security.Permissions.SecurityPermission with setting 'Unrestricted=true' is not allowed.

message: Do not define 'EnvironmentPermission' with 'Unrestricted=true'
description: The CAS Policy for System.Security.Permissions.EnvironmentPermission with setting 'Unrestricted=true' is not allowed.

message: Do not define 'SmtpPermission' with 'Unrestricted=true'
description: The CAS Policy for System.Net.Mail.SmtpPermission with setting 'Unrestricted=true' is not allowed.

message: Do not set 'AllowEveryoneViewItems' to TRUE in ListDefinition
description: The attribute ListAllowEveryoneViewItems of a ListDefinition should not be set to true, as it allows every authenticated user of the web application to access the list items when the URL is known.

message: Do not use inline code in ASPX pages
description: ASPX pages should not contain inline code. Use code behind instead.

message: FormDigest' to ASPX page
description: ASPX pages should contain 'SharePoint:FormDigest' to ensure security validation of requests,

message: Do not override system files
description: Solutions must not override system files. If this solution is deployed it could damage the SharePoint farm and make it unreachable.

message: Do not access SharePoint API via reflection
description: It is not supported to access non public properties or methods of the SharePoint API, e.g. via reflection.

message: Do not read ConnectionString from SPContentDatabase
description: There is no reason to read the connection string of a SharePoint content database except if you want to read from the database which is not supported.

message: Do not query SharePoint databases directly
description: It is not allowed to read or write directly to SharePoint databases. Use API, webservices etc. instead.

message: Declare attribute 'Title' and 'Description' in Solutions
description: To make it easier to identify Solutions in the Solution Gallery in SharePoint the attributes 'Title' and 'Description' should be declared.

message: Define AssemblyFileVersion in Assembly
description: In SharePoint changing the AssemblyVersion very frequently can lead to problems, because the full name of the assembly could be used in features or webparts. However, to identify the version of the assembly the attribute 'AssemblyFileVersion' should be used (used with same major version but incremented minor version, build etc.)

message: Do not store Urls hardcoded in Assembly
description: Remove hard coded Urls from the code and make them configurable.

message: Do not create ContentTypes in code
description: ContentTypes should be created declaratively in XML and not in code.

message: Do not inherit WebParts from Microsoft.SharePoint.WebPartPages.WebPart
description: WebParts should be inherited from the ASP.NET Webpart (System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart). Do not inherit from the SharePoint WebPart.

message: Do not make SiteDefinition visible in the whole farm
description: Site definitions are visible in the whole farm by default. The attribute 'VisibilityFeatureDependency' provides a way to hide the site definition depending on an activated feature.

message: Declare attribute 'Description' in Features
description: A Feature should contain a description of the purpose of a Feature in attribute 'Description'.

message: Declare attribute 'Version' in Features
description: A feature should contain a valid version number in attribute 'Version'. This may be necessary to use FeatureUpgrade method to allow updates in the future.

message: Make Features with scope 'Farm' or 'WebApplication' visible
description: Feature of scope 'Farm' or 'WebApplication' should not be hidden. They are not visible for the farm administrator in the Central Administration and cannot be deactivated via the UI e.g. in case of problems. If the feature is visible in the Central Administration the farm administrator can easier identify available and activated features.

message: Consider to make Feature with scope 'Web' or 'Site' hidden
description: Consider to make Features with scope 'Web' or 'Site' hidden to avoid activation via the UI.

message: Declare attribute 'Title' and 'Description' in FeatureActivitationDependencies
description: To make it easier to identify feature activation dependencies the attributes title and description should contain the title and description of the referenced feature.

message: Define attribute 'ReceiverAssembly' in Feature as full qualified assembly name
description: If a Feature references an Assembly in attribute 'ReceiverAssembly' the given value should be a full qualified assembly name (e.g. 'System.Data, Version=1.0.3300.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089'). Although the order of the values in the assembly name is not mandatory a well-formed assembly name improves readability of the XML code.

message: Declare all FieldTypes in a single file
description: If multiple FieldTypes are deployed by a Solution these FieldTypes should be store in a single XML file to avoid unnecessary files.

message: Declare attribute 'Inherits' in ContentTypes
description: In SharePoint 2010 the new attribute 'Inherits' for ContentTypes defines whether fields of the parent ContentType are inherited to the ContentType. For compatibility reasons to SharePoint 2007 this attribute should be specified.

message: Define attribute 'ID' in ContentTypes uppercase
description: The ID of a ContentType should by a GUID in uppercase letters to avoid problems when accessing ContentTypes in code.

message: Declare 'TemplateType' and 'FeatureId' for external ListInstance
description: If the ListInstance seems to be used for an external list, the correct TemplateType (600) should be used.

message: Declare attribute 'Description' in CustomActionGroup
description: CustomActionGroup should define attribute Description.

message: Declare attribute 'Sequence' in DelegateControl.
description: Attribute 'Sequence' should be declared to specify the sequence number for the control, which determines whether the control is added to the control tree for a page. The control with the lowest sequence number is added to the tree.

message: Declare attribute 'Id' in DelegateControl.
description: Attribute 'Id' should be declared. Otherwise the delegate control will never be added to a control container.

message: Declare property 'Title' and 'Description' in WebPart
description: A WebPart should contain the attribute title and description to provide meaningfull information to the end user which would add the web part to a page.

message: Do not write in ASPX Pages 'Register' tags in a single line
description: ASPX pages should write the Register tag in separate lines to improve readability of the code.

message: Avoid inline JavaScript in ASPX Pages
description: ASPX pages should not contain JavaScript code. Use separate .JS files instead.

message: Avoid inline CSS in ASPX Pages
description: ASPX pages should not contain CSS code. Use separate .CSS files instead.

message: Do not use spaces in file or folders names
description: Files should be stored in subfolders which are named after the solution, or start with the solution. Avoid using dots or spaces in pathnames.

message: Instantiate a new SPSite inside RunWithElevatedPrivileges
description: An SPSite object created outside the delegate can be referenced inside the delegate, however, the methods and property assessors of the object run with the privileges of the user context in which the objects were created, not with the elevated privileges.

message: Do not call SPList.Items
description: Do not call SPList.Items. Use SPList.GetItems(SPQuery query) instead.

message: Do not call SPList.Items.GetItemById()
description: Do not call SPList.Items.GetItemById(). Use SPList.GetItemById instead.

message: Do not call SPList.Items[]
description: Do not call SPList.Items[int] or SPList.Items[Guid]. Use SPList.GetItemByUniqueId(Guid) or SPList.GetItemById(int) instead.

message: Do not call SPList.Items.Count
description: Do not call SPList.Items.Count. Use SPList.ItemCount instead.

message: Do not call SPListItemVersion.Delete to delete multiple versions
description: When you delete multiple versions of a list item, use the DeleteByID() method; do not use the Delete() method. You will experience performance problems if you delete each SPListItemVersion object from an SPListItemVersionCollection object.

message: Do not call SPFileVersion.Delete to delete multiple versions
description: When you delete multiple versions of a file, use the DeleteByID() method; do not use the Delete() method. You will experience performance problems if you delete each SPFileVersion object from an SPFileVersionVersionCollection object.

message: Do not enable ObjectTracking in Linq.DataContext
description: If your code only queries lists, rather than adding, deleting, or editing list items, then you can turn off object change tracking. Doing so will improve performance. Set the ObjectTrackingEnabled property to false.

message: Do not access SPListCollection by indexer multiple times
description: Do not access SPListCollection by indexer multiple times. Instantiates the list object only once and assigns it to a variable in order to set properties and call methods.

message: Do not call SPFolder.Files.Count
description: Do not call SPFolder.Files.Count. Use SPFolder.ItemCount instead.

message: Use SPBuiltInContentTypeId to reference builtin ContentType
description: Use SPBuiltInContentTypeId to reference builtin ContentType.

message: Use SPBuiltInFieldId to reference builtin Field
description: Use SPBuiltInFieldId to reference builtin Field.

message: Define RowLimit for SPQuery
description: Define RowLimit for SPQuery to limit the number of items returned in the query.

message: Avoid using AppSettings to store configuration values
description: Avoid storing or reading configuration values in web.config via AppSettings.

message: Apply lock when caching SharePoint objects
description: Some SharePoint objects are not thread safe and caching can cause applications to fail and cause unexpected or unrelated user errors. To avoid this ensure locking of cached objects.

message: Do not call SPItemEventProperties.OpenWeb()
description: Do not call SPItemEventProperties.OpenWeb(). Use the newly introduced SPItemEventProperties.Web property instead for better performance and to avoid the need to call Dispose().

message: Do not request SPField from SPFieldCollection by index. Use SPFieldCollection.GetField() instead.
description: Calling SPFieldCollection[] to retrieve a SPField in a web could fail if not the display name is used as argument. Better use SPWeb.Fields.GetField() which returns the field with the specified internal, display, or static name.

message: Do not call SPWeb.GetListFromUrl. Use SPWeb.GetListFromWebPartPageUrl instead.
description: SPWeb.GetListFromUrl gets the list that is associated with the first Web Part on the specified Web Parts page. Beginning in Windows SharePoint Services 3.0, use the GetListFromWebPartPageUrl method instead of this method.

message: Assign RowLimit for SPQuery in limited range
description: Assign RowLimit for SPQuery within the limited range (default 1 to 2000).

message: Do not activate or deactivate Features via API
description: Do not activate or deactivate Features in code via API. Consider using Powershell or Feature Stapling.

message: Custom field types should not be user creatable
description: Custom field types should not be user creatable because in this case they are visible in the complete farm which may not be the intention.

message: Consider using SPContentTypeCollection.BestMatch(SPContentTypeId) to retrieve a Content Type
description: Use SPContentTypeCollection.BestMatch(string) to retrieve a Content Type from a SPContentTypeCollection.

message: Define Type of ListTemplate greater than 10000
description: The ListTemplate Type should be greater than 10000. This makes it easier to identify custom ListTemplates.

message: Do not instantiate SPList in Receiver
description: Do not instantiate an SPList object within an event receiver.

message: Do not instantiate SPListItem in Receiver
description: Do not instantiate an SPListItem object within an event receiver.

message: Do not instantiate SPSite in Receiver
description: Do not instantiate an SPSite object within an event receiver.

message: Do not instantiate SPWeb in Receiver
description: Do not instantiate an SPWeb object within an event receiver.

message: Consider the deployment of solution per web application and not globally
description: Solution should not be deployed globally to reduce the impact of the solution for the SharePoint farm. Add either SafeControls, DWPFiles, CASPolicies or ApplicationResourceFiles to ensure that the solution is deployed to a dedicated web application.

message: Do not deploy prohibited assemblies
description: In some case WSPBuilder includes prohibited assemblies into the package, e.g. 'ssocli.dll'.

message: Do not deploy thumbs.db
description: In some case the file thumbs.db is generated in a Visual Studio project. This file should not be included in the WSP package.

message: Do not reset webserver
description: A solution should not reset the webserver.

message: Define mode 'Recycle' for Solution upgrade
description: To reduce the downtime of a SharePoint farm during deployment the solution should not use default setting 'StartStop' for upgrading solutions. Spedifying 'Recycle' only recycles affected application pools and will not stop them.

message: Do not deploy files directly into system folder
description: Solutions should not write in folders of system files directly. If you need to deploy a file in a system folder, use a project specific subfolder.

message: Do not deploy batch files (.bat)
description: Batch files should not be included in the WSP package.

message: Do not deploy PowerShell scripts (.ps1)
description: PowerShell scripts should not be included in the WSP package.

message: Do not deploy setups (.msi)
description: Setups like .msi files should not be included in the WSP package.

message: Deploy Assembly which must run in full trust to GAC
description: The Assembly must be deployed to global assembly cache because it contains code which must be run in full trust or must be avaible to other components or services.

message: Avoid deployment of Assembly to GAC if it is not necessary
description: Assemblies should only be deployed to global assembly cache (GAC) if they contain e.g. feature receivers, event receivers, timer jobs or workflows. Consider the deployment to WebApplication.

message: Do not deploy assembly with DEBUG mode
description: Assembly should be build with RELEASE mode. Main reason is to prevent running code which is defined within #DEBUG preprocessor directive and which typically should not run in productive environments.

message: Do not deploy SharePoint assemblies
description: In some case Visual Studio or WSPBuilder include SharePoint assemblies into the package (e.g. Microsoft.Search.dll). This is not allowed.

message: Do not deploy assembly multiple times
description: In some case the same assembly is included in several WSP packages of the same solution. This can occur if Visual Studio or WSPBuilder includes the files automatically into the WSP package.

message: Do not deploy empty Assemblies
description: Assemblies without custom classes should not be deployed to SharePoint. This helps to reduce unneeded IISResets during deployment.

message: Do not deploy SPWebConfigModifications via features
description: Deployment of SPWebConfigModifications with a feature receiver should be avoided. The activation of this feature will start a timer job and will initiate the restart of services which may lead to problems during a deployment. Consider deploying of SPWebConfigModifications via PowerShell script or supplemental config file.

message: Do not deploy RootFile to TEMPLATE folder
description: Deploy a RootFile not to the TEMPLATE folder. Deploy this file as TemplateFile in the solution.

message: Do not deploy RootFile multiple times
description: Deploy a RootFile only once to SharePoint. Do not deploy the file by different solutions because this could lead to problems if one solution is retracted and removes the file.

message: Do not deploy Images to LAYOUTS folder
description: Do not deploy Images to LAYOUTS folder. Deploy to IMAGES folder instead.

message: Deploy only Images to IMAGES folder
description: Deploy only Images to IMAGES folder. For files which are not images choose a different folder (e.g. LAYOUTS).

message: Deploy binary files (like Assemblies) to ClientBin folder
description: Binary files should be deployed to LAYOUTS/ClientBin folder. This helps to find these files at the correct location.

message: Do not deploy TemplateFile multiple times
description: Deploy a TemplateFile only once to SharePoint. Do not deploy the file by different solutions because this could lead to problems if one solution is retracted and removes the file.

message: Do not deploy files of a Feature as TemplateFile
description: File which are deployed into the folder of a Feature should not be deployed as TemplateFile. Either deploy the files as ElementFiles in the Feature (preferred) or as Resources in manifest.xml.

message: Do not deploy Features ElementFiles as Resources
description: Resource files can be used to deploy resources to an existing Feature folder. If the target Feature is part of the same solution package binary files should be deployed as ElementFile in the Feature. If the target Feature is not part of the package it does make sense to use Resources (e.g. to deploy additional languages to existing features).

message: Deploy missing image for Feature
description: If a custom icon for a Feature is defined in attribute 'ImageUrl' the file should be deployed to SharePoint if not a SharePoint default image is used.

message: Deploy missing ElementManifest or ElementFile in Feature
description: If ElementManifests or ElementFile are listed in the feature.xml these files must be deployed within the solution package.

message: Do not deploy feature with same folder name multiple times
description: In some case the same feature is included in different WSP packages.

message: Do not deploy feature with same ID name multiple times
description: In some case the same feature is included in different WSP packages.

message: Do not deploy empty ElementManifests in Features
description: ElementManifests files in Features which do not contain any element have no purpose and should be removed from the solution.

message: Do not deploy Webservice (.asmx) to LAYOUTS folder
description: A Webservice (.asmx) should not be deployed to '\TEMPLATE\LAYOUTS\' folder (url: '../_layouts/..'). It should be deployed to '\ISAPI\' instead (url '../vti_bin/..').

message: Do not deploy Administration Webservice (.asmx) to ADMIN folder
description: A Administration Webservice (.asmx) should not be deployed to '\TEMPLATE\ADMIN\' folder (url: '../_admin/..'). It should be deployed to '\ADMISAPI\' instead (url '../vti_adm/..').

message: Do not deploy a WCF Webservice (.svc) to LAYOUTS folder
description: A WCF Webservice (.svc) should not be deployed to '\TEMPLATE\LAYOUTS\' folder (url: '../_layouts/..'). It should be deployed to '\ISAPI\' instead (url '../vti_bin/..').

message: Do not deploy a WCF Administration Webservice (.svc) to ADMIN folder
description: A WCF Administration Webservice (.svc) should not be deployed to '\TEMPLATE\ADMIN\' folder (url: '../_admin/..'). It should be deployed to '\ADMISAPI\' instead (url '../vti_adm/..').

message: Deploy missing image for WebTemplate
description: If a custom icon for a WebTemplate is defined in attribute 'ImageUrl' the file should be deployed to SharePoint if not a SharePoint default image is used.

message: Use resources for localizable attributes
description: All localizable attributes of SharePoint artefacts like ContentType, Feature etc. should use resources.

message: Move resource key of ElementManifest to Feature resources
description: Localized attributes in ElementManifests (like ContentType) should use resources in the parent Feature, not in a RootFile (like '15\Resources\ResourceFile.resx').

message: Localize property 'Title' and 'Description' in WebPart
description: Properties 'Title' and 'Description' in WebParts should be localized with .resx file.

message: Define Solution name as valid namespace
description: To make it easier to identify the correct wsp solution in the solution store the name of the solution should be a valid namespace (e.g. 'Company.Project.Components.wsp').

message: Files or Folders should contain the name of the parent solution
description: Files or their folders should be named after the solution. This helps do make the file location unique to prevent overwriting of existing files and it is easier to see which WSP solution deployed the file. The rule is case sensitive.

message: Solution name should start with company name
description: The solution name should start with company name to follow the rule 'CompanyName.ApplicationName.ComponentName.wsp'.

message: WebTemplate file in site definitions should start with 'WEBTEMP'
description: The name of the WebTemplate files should start with 'WEBTEMP'.

message: Feature name should start with solution name
description: A feature name should be prefixed with the name of the parent solution. This helps to make the feature name unique and it is easier to see which WSP solution deployed the feature. The rule is case sensitive.

message: Declare FieldType in File 'fldtypes_[namespace].xml'
description: The XML file which contains FieldTypes should follow the pattern 'fldtypes_[Namespace].xml'. [Namespace] represents the name of the WSP solution with replaced '.' with underscore. Reason: All FieldTypes are deployed to folder /SharePointRoot/Templates/XML and therefore must be stored in a file with a unique filename to avoid overriding existing FieldTypes from SharePoint or other custom solutions.

message: Do not deploy ControlTemplates
description: Depending on the customization policy Solutions should not deploy controltemplates.

message: Do not deploy Feature with scope 'Farm'
description: Depending on the customization policy Solutions should not contain farm features.

message: Do not deploy Feature with scope 'WebApplication'
description: Depending on the customization policy Solutions should not contain webapplication features.

message: Do not create managed paths in code
description: The assembly should not create managed paths in a web application.

message: Do not implement IHttpHandler
description: The assembly should not implement the interface IHttpHandler.

message: Do not implement IHttpModule
description: The assembly should not implement the interface IHttpModule.

message: Do not implement SPJobDefinition (TimerJob)
description: The assembly should not implement the interface SPJobDefinition in gold environments.

message: Do not implement FeatureReceiver
description: The assembly should not types inherited from 'Microsoft.SharePoint.SPFeatureReceiver'.

message: Do not implement SPWebConfigModifications
description: The assembly should not implement SPWebConfigModifications.

message: Do not implement Pluggable Autentication Provider
description: The assembly should not implement Pluggable Autentication Provider.

message: Do not implement Pluggable SSO Provider
description: The assembly should not implement Pluggable SSO Provider.

message: Do not implement SiteDefinition
description: Depending on the customization policy do not implement a SiteDefinition.

message: Do not implement FieldType
description: Depending on the customization policy do not implement a custom FieldType.

message: Do not implement Field
description: Depending on the customization policy do not implement a Field.

message: Do not implement ContentType
description: Depending on the customization policy do not implement a ContentType.

message: Do not implement ListDefinition
description: Depending on the customization policy do not implement a ListDefinition.

message: Do not implement CustomAction
description: Depending on the customization policy do not implement a CustomAction.

message: Do not implement CustomActionGroup
description: Depending on the customization policy do not implement a CustomActionGroup.

message: Do not implement Event Receiver
description: Depending on the customization policy do not implement an Event Receiver.

message: Do not implement DelegateControl
description: Depending on the customization policy do not implement a DelegateControl.

message: Do not implement Coded Worfklow
description: Depending on the customization policy do not implement a Coded Worfklow.

message: Do not implement DocumentConverter
description: Depending on the customization policy do not implement a DocumentConveter.

message: Do not use inline code in ASPX pages
description: ASPX pages should not contain inline code.

message: Do not implement FeatureTemplateAssocation
description: Depending on the customization policy do not implement a FeatureTemplateAssocation.

message: Add attribute 'AllowPartiallyTrustedCallers'
description: Code in the sandboxed worker process can call only assemblies that have the AllowPartiallyTrustedCallersAttribute.

message: Do not reference unavailable NET 3.5 assemblies
description: Code in the sandbox runs as a partially trusted caller. This means that such code can access only those .NET Framework 3.5 assemblies that have the AllowPartiallyTrustedCallersAttribute attribute.

message: Do not use unallowed SharePoint classes
description: Only a subset of the APIs in Microsoft.SharePoint.dll are available in sandboxed solutions.

message: Do not inherit WebParts from SharePoint WebPart
description: Sandboxed solutions can include only Web Parts derived from the ASP.NET class.

message: Do not reference assemblies without AllowPartiallyTrustedCallers attribute
description: Code in the sandboxed worker process can call only assemblies that have the AllowPartiallyTrustedCallersAttribute. This means that most custom assemblies that you deploy in sandboxed solutions must have this attribute.

message: Do not create static fields and properties
description: Avoid creating static fields and properties in your sandboxed code.

message: Create SPSite with correct parameters
description: A new SPSite can only be instantiated in sandboxed solutions if calling code conforms to certain restrictions on the parameters that are passed.

message: Do not set Read-Only Properties
description: Some properties of SharePoint objects are read/write in farm solutions, but are read-only in sandboxed solutions.

message: Do not deploy Assembly to GAC
description: Assemblies cannot be deployed to GAC in Sandboxed Solutions

message: Do not deploy RootFiles
description: RootFiles cannot be deployed in a sandboxed solution.

message: Do not deploy TemplateFiles
description: TemplateFiles cannot be deployed in a sandboxed solution.

message: Do not deploy Resources
description: Resources cannot be deployed in a sandboxed solution.

message: Do not deploy Farm Features
description: Features with scope 'Farm' cannot be deployed in a sandboxed solution.

message: Do not deploy WebApplication Features
description: Features with scope 'WebApplication' cannot be deployed in a sandboxed solution.

message: Do not deploy CustomActionGroup
description: CustomActionGroup cannot be deployed in a sandboxed solution.

message: Do not deploy HideCustomAction
description: You cannot deploy a HideCustomAction element in a sandboxed solution.

message: Do not deploy Delegate Control
description: You cannot register a control candidate for a delegate control (Control element) in a sandboxed solution.

message: Dispose created SPSite objects
description: When you create a SPSite object with a new operator, the creating application must dispose of it.

message: Dispose SPWeb objects created with SPSite.OpenWeb
description: The OpenWeb method create an SPWeb object and return it to the caller. This new object is not stored in the SPSite object and is not disposed of anywhere in the SPSite class. For this reason, you should dispose of any object created via these methods.

message: Dispose SPSite objects created with SPSite.SelfServiceCreateSite
description: The SelfServiceCreateSite method (all signatures) create an SPWeb object and return it to the caller. This new object is not stored in the SPSite object and is not disposed of anywhere in the SPSite class. For this reason, you should dispose of any object created via these methods.

message: Dispose SPWeb created by SPLimitedWebPartManager
description: The SPLimitedWebPartManager class contains a reference to an internal SPWeb object that must be disposed.

message: Dispose SPSite created by SPSiteCollection.Add
description: The SPSiteCollection.Add method creates and returns a new SPSite object. You should dispose of any SPSite object returned from the SPSiteCollection.Add method.

message: Dispose SPSite created by SPSiteCollection[] index operator
description: The SPSiteCollection [] index operator returns a new SPSite object for each access. An SPSite instance is created even if that object was already accessed.

message: Dispose SPWeb created by SPWebCollection.Add
description: The SPSite.AllWebs.Add method and SPWebCollection.Add method creates and returns an SPWeb object. You should dispose of any SPWeb object returned.

message: Dispose SPWeb created by SPWebCollection[] index operator
description: The SPSite.AllWebs[] and SPWebCollection[] index operator returns a new SPWeb instance each time it is accessed. An object is created during the indexing operation even if that object was already accessed.

message: Do not dispose SPListEventProperties.Web
description: The SPWeb object in SPListEventProperties (e.g. used in a SPListEventReceiver) should not be disposed.

message: Do not dispose SPWebEventProperties.Web
description: The SPWeb object in SPWebEventProperties (e.g. used in a SPWebEventReceiver) should not be disposed.

message: Do not dispose SPItemEventProperties.Web
description: The SPWeb object in SPItemEventProperties (e.g. used in a SPItemEventReceiver) should not be disposed.

message: Do not dispose SPItemEventProperties.ListItem.Web
description: The object in SPItemEventProperties.ListItem.Web (e.g. used in a SPItemEventReceiver) should not be disposed.

message: Do not dispose SPItemEventProperties.Web.Site
description: The object in SPItemEventProperties.Web.Site (e.g. used in a SPItemEventReceiver) should not be disposed.

message: Do not dispose SPItemEventProperties.ListItem.Web.Site
description: The object in SPItemEventProperties.ListItem.Web.Site (e.g. used in a SPItemEventReceiver) should not be disposed.

message: Do not dispose SPFeatureReceiverProperties.Feature.Parent
description: The object in SPFeatureReceiverProperties.Feature.Parent (e.g. used in a SPFeatureReceiver) should not be disposed.

message: Do not dispose SPSite.RootWeb
description: An earlier version of the documentation indicated that the calling application should dispose of the SPSite.RootWeb property just before disposing of the SPSite object that is using it. This is no longer the official guidance. The dispose cleanup is handled automatically by the SharePoint framework.

message: Do not dispose SPWeb.ParentWeb
description: An earlier version of the documentation recommended that the calling application should dispose of the SPWeb.ParentWeb. This is no longer the official guidance. The dispose cleanup is handled automatically by the SharePoint framework.

message: Do not dispose SPList.ParentWeb
description: An earlier version of the documentation recommended that the calling application should dispose of the SPWeb.ParentWeb. This is no longer the official guidance. The dispose cleanup is handled automatically by the SharePoint framework.

message: Do not dispose SPSite returned by SPControl.GetContextSite
description: If SPSite is obtained from the SharePoint context objects (GetContextSite method), the calling application should not call the Dispose method on the object.

message: Do not dispose SPWeb returned by SPControl.GetContextWeb
description: If SPWeb is obtained from the SharePoint context objects (GetContextWeb method), the calling application should not call the Dispose method on the object.

message: Do not dispose SPSite returned by SPContext.Current.Site
description: SPContext objects are managed by the SharePoint framework and should not be explicitly disposed in your code. This is true also for the SPSite objects returned by SPContext.Site and SPContext.Current.Site

message: Do not dispose SPWeb returned by SPContext.Current.Web
description: SPContext objects are managed by the SharePoint framework and should not be explicitly disposed in your code. This is true also for the SPWeb objects returned by SPContext.Web and SPContext.Current.Web

message: Close PublishingWeb created by PublishingWeb.GetPublishingWebs[] index operator
description: The GetPublishingWebs method of the PublishingWeb class returns a PublishingWebCollection object. You must call the Close method on each enumerated innerPubWeb object. When you are calling only the GetPublishingWeb method, you are not required to call Close.

message: Close PublishingWeb created by PublishingWeb.GetVariation
description: The Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.PublishingWeb.GetVariation method returns a PublishingWeb object that must be closed.

message: Close PublishingWeb created by PublishingWebCollection.Add
description: PublishingWebCollection.Add() method requires you to call Close on the returned PublishingWeb object.

message: Dispose SPSite created with UserProfiles.PersonalSite
description: The Microsoft.Office.Server.UserProfiles.PersonalSite returns an SPSite object that must be disposed.

message: Do not inherit ASPX page from SharePoint assemblies older than Version 12
description: ASPX pages should not inherit from previous or later version of Microsoft.SharePoint assemblies.

message: Reference SharePoint 12 assemblies
description: ASPX files should not reference previous or later versions of Microsoft.SharePoint assemblies.

message: Do not call deprecated methods or properties
description: Assembly should not call deprecated methods or properties.

message: Do not implement deprecated interfaces
description: Assembly should not implement deprecated interfaces.

message: Do not inherit from deprecated type
description: Assembly should not inherit from deprecated type.

message: Do not reference deprecated types
description: Assembly should not reference deprecated types.

message: Inherit from SharePoint 14 assemblies
description: ASPX pages should not inherit from previous or later version of Microsoft.SharePoint assemblies.

message: Reference SharePoint 14 assemblies
description: ASPX files should not reference previous or later versions of Microsoft.SharePoint assemblies.

message: Do not define CAS Policies
description: The assemblies in a farm solution in SharePoint 2010 could be deployed with Custom Access Security (CAS) policies. Such policies are ignored in SharePoint 2013; all assemblies in farm solutions in SharePoint 2013 run with full trust.

message: Declare attribute SharePointProductVersion='15.0' in Solution
description: The attribute 'SharePointProductVersion' with value '15.0' must be declared if files in 15 hive should be loaded. If not declared SharePoint assumes version '14.0'.

message: Do not call deprecated methods or properties
description: Assembly should not call deprecated methods or properties.

message: Do not implement deprecated interfaces
description: Assembly should not implement deprecated interfaces.

message: Do not inherit from deprecated type
description: Assembly should not inherit from deprecated type.

message: Do not reference deprecated types
description: Assembly should not reference deprecated types.

message: Do not call CustomizeCss and RevertCss from Microsoft.SharePoint.SoapServer.Webs
description: Do not call CustomizeCss and RevertCss from namespace Microsoft.SharePoint.SoapServer.Webs. The methods are included in SharePoint 2013, but will be removed from the next major release of SharePoint.

message: Build assembly for .NET Framework 4.5
description: The Assembly should be build for target Framework version 4.5.

message: Reference 15 hive in strings within code
description: References in strings in the code to hive folder '/_controltemplates', '/_layouts' and '/_layouts/images/' must be changed accordingly to point to the 15 hive (e.g. by changing to '/_controltemplates/15/').

message: Reference 15 hive in attribute 'Image' in ListTemplate
description: A ListTemplate can reference an image (like an icon) in attribute 'Image'. Ensure that the URL points to the 15 hive.

message: Reference 15 hive in all images in CustomAction
description: A CustomAction can reference several images (like icons). Ensure that the URLs for these images points to the 15 hive.

message: Reference 15 hive in attribute 'UrlAction' in CustomAction
description: A CustomAction can reference a page in attribute 'UrlAction'. Ensure that the URL points to the 15 hive.

message: Reference 15 hive in attribute 'ScriptSrc' in CustomAction
description: A CustomAction can reference a script (e.g. .js) in attribute 'ScriptSrc'. Ensure that the URL points to the 15 hive.

message: Reference 15 hive in attribute 'ControlSrc' in DelegateControl
description: A DelegateControl can reference a control template in attribute 'ControlSrc'. Ensure that the URL points to the 15 hive.

message: Register SharePoint 15 Assemblies in ASCX Control
description: ASCX Control should not register previous versions of Microsoft.SharePoint assemblies.

message: Reference SharePoint 15 Assemblies in ASCX Control
description: ASCX Controls should not reference previous versions of Microsoft.SharePoint assemblies.

message: Inherit ASPX Page from SharePoint 15 Assemblies
description: ASPX Pages should not inherit from previous or later version of Microsoft.SharePoint assemblies.

message: Register SharePoint 15 Assemblies in ASPX Page
description: ASPX Pages should not register previous versions of Microsoft.SharePoint assemblies.

message: Reference SharePoint 15 Assemblies in ASPX Page
description: ASPX Pages should not reference previous versions of Microsoft.SharePoint assemblies.

message: Do not define TemplateAssociation to template 'Document Workspace'
description: The site template for 'Document Workspace' (STS#2) is not available in SP 2013.

message: Do not define TemplateAssociation to templates for 'Meeting Workspace'
description: The site templates for 'Meeting Workspace' (MPS#*) is not available in SP 2013. This includes the Basic Meeting Workspace, Blank Meeting Workspace, Decision Meeting Workspace, Social Meeting Workspace, and Multipage Meeting Workspace.

message: Do not define TemplateAssociation to template 'Personalization Site'
description: The site template for 'Personalization Site' (SPSMSITE#0) is not available in SP 2013.

message: Do not define TemplateAssociation to templates for 'Group Work'
description: The site templates for 'Group Work' (SGS) is not available in SP 2013.

message: Register SharePoint 15 Assemblies in Master Page
description: Master Pages should not register previous versions of Microsoft.SharePoint assemblies.

message: Reference SharePoint 15 Assemblies in Master Page
description: Master Pages should not reference previous versions of Microsoft.SharePoint assemblies.

message: Reference 15 hive within all Pages (.aspx)
description: Paths in Pages to '/_controltemplates/', '/_layouts/' and '/_layouts/images/' should point to 15 hive.

message: Reference 15 hive within all Masterpages (.master)
description: Paths in Masterpages to '/_controltemplates/', '/_layouts/' and '/_layouts/images/' should point to 15 hive.

message: Reference 15 hive within all Scripts (.js)
description: Paths in Scripts to '/_controltemplates/', '/_layouts/' and '/_layouts/images/' should point to 15 hive.

message: Reference 15 hive within all Styles (.css)
description: Paths in Styles to '/_controltemplates/', '/_layouts/' and '/_layouts/images/' should point to 15 hive.

message: Reference 15 hive within all Controls (.ascx)
description: Paths in Controls to '/_controltemplates/', '/_layouts/' and '/_layouts/images/' should point to 15 hive.

message: Reference 15 hive within all XSLT files (.xslt)
description: Paths in XSLT files to '/_controltemplates/', '/_layouts/' and '/_layouts/images/' should point to 15 hive.
